com.tiggerbiggo.prima.calculation

Class ColorTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiggerbiggo.prima.calculation.ColorTools

  • public class ColorTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains various static methods for calculating things like Hue, Saturation, Brightness, etc. using with the java.awt.Color class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ColorTools()

      • colorLerp

        public static java.awt.Color colorLerp(java.awt.Color c1,
                                       java.awt.Color c2,
                                       double a)
        Linearly interpolates between 2 colors. See lerp() for more information on how this functions.
        Parameters:
        c1 - Start color
        c2 - End color
        a - Interpolation coefficient
        Returns:
        new Color value generated from c1 and c2

      • colorAvg

        public static java.awt.Color colorAvg(java.awt.Color... colors)

      • getBrightness

        public static double getBrightness(java.awt.Color in)
        Calculates the brightness value of a given color
        Parameters:
        in - The colour to calculate
        Returns:
        The brightness value of the colour, between 0 and 1

      • getSaturation

        public static double getSaturation(java.awt.Color in)
        Calculates the saturation value of a given color
        Parameters:
        in - The colour to calculate
        Returns:
        The saturation value of the colour, between 0 and 1

      • getHue

        public static double getHue(java.awt.Color in)
        Calculates the hue of a given color
        Parameters:
        in - The colour to calculate
        Returns:
        The hue of the colour, between 0 and 1

      • getMax

        public static int getMax(java.awt.Color in)
        Given a color, separates the RGB components and returns the largest value.

        e.g getMax(new Color(50, 60, 70)) would return 70.

        Parameters:
        in - The color to calculate
        Returns:
        The maximum RGB component

      • getMin

        public static int getMin(java.awt.Color in)
        Given a color, separates the RGB components and returns the smallest value.

        e.g getMax(new Color(50, 60, 70)) would return 50.

        Parameters:
        in - The color to calculate
        Returns:
        The minimum RGB component
